English: Ohhh Ryuuuuuuujiiii! Over here, over here!
Chinese: 你來了呀～龍司小親親～☆　這裡這裡～☆
Korean: 하이~, 류지♥ 이쪽이야 이쪽♥
German: Ach, Ryuuujiii! Hier drüben, hier!

English: Oh, that's no good!
Chinese: 哎呀，你這樣不對啦♪
Korean: 앙, 안 돼♪
German: Ach, wie unhöflich!

English:
No "sorry for the wait" or anything? You'll never
get a girl with that attitude.
Chinese:
這時候就該說“等很久了嗎？”，
或是“遲到了抱歉”才對嘛。
你不這樣回應我的話，姐姐我會很寂寞喔☆
Korean:
거기선「기다렸어?」라던가「늦어서 미안하다」하고
응해주지 않으면 누님 재미없다구♥
German:
Kein „Entschuldige, dass du warten musstest“?
Mit so einer Einstellung kriegst du nie ein
Mädchen ab.

English: ...I didn't come here for jokes.
Chinese: …………我不是來跟妳開玩笑的。
Korean: …………농담하러 온 게 아냐
German: ... Ich bin nicht wegen der Witze hier.

English:
So young, yet so serious! Not that I hate that
about you...
Chinese:
真是的，明明還年輕就這麼死板～
不過你這點我也不討厭喔☆
Korean:
정말, 젊은데도 성실하네~
그런 점도 싫지는 않지만♥
German:
So jung und schon so ernst! Nicht, dass mir das
an dir missfällt ...

English: ...The data, as promised.
Chinese: ……這是之前說好的數據。
Korean: ……약속한 데이터다
German: ... Die Daten, wie versprochen.

English:
Hee hee... Yes, here they are...my puh-reh-cious
corporate accounts!
Chinese:
嗚呼，嗚呼呼……
是我們公司高層的帳．號．耶☆
Korean:
우후, 우후후……
우리 중역들의 계 정♥
German:
Hihi ... Ja, hier sind sie ... Meine tollen
Geschäftskonten!

English:
Every last one of them, too! The way you work is
smooth and sexy as ever, Ryuji!
Chinese:
這不是好好地幫我弄好了嘛～
每次工作的效率都好快唷，龍司小親親♪
Korean:
제대로 가져왔잖아~
언제나 일처리가 깔끔해서 멋져, 류지♪
German:
Und es sind alle dabei! Deine Arbeitsweise ist
so zügig und sexy wie immer, Ryuji!

English:
I took care of the guy that used Kayaba to
raid these accounts.
Chinese:
茅場雇來狩獵帳號的男人……
已經被做掉了。
Korean: 카야바가 계정 사냥에 이용한 남자……당했더군
German:
Ich habe mich um den Typen gekümmert, der Kayaba
benutzt hat, um diese Accounts zu stehlen.

English:
Hmm? Well who cares about that? That guy was just
a sweet plaything to use and throw away.
Chinese:
嗯嗯？　這不算什麼啊。
那種人，本來就是用完就丟的玩具嘛♪
Korean:
응응? 별 것 아냐.
그 애, 원래부터 쓰고 버리기 위한 장난감이었는걸♪
German:
Hm? Wen interessiert das denn? Der Typ war doch
nur ein nettes Einweg-Spielzeug.

English: Are you the reason he started acting funny?
Chinese: 該不會，那傢伙會變奇怪的原因是妳？
Korean: 혹시 녀석이 이상해진 것도 당신 짓인가?
German:
Hat er sich wegen dir plötzlich so seltsam
verhalten?

English: Hee hee, I don't know what you're talking about.
Chinese: 嘻嘻，你覺得呢～？
Korean: 우후훗, 과연 어떨까~?
German: Hihi, ich weiß nicht, wovon du redest.

English:
Still...I can say that you shouldn't just wear
something you get from someone else.
Chinese:
不管怎樣……我只能說，從別人那拿到的東西
不要輕易帶到身上比較好唷♪
Korean:
하지만……남에게 받은 것을 안이하게 지니고 다니지 않는 편이
좋다는 것 정도는 말해줄 수 있겠는걸♪
German:
Ich kann nur sagen, dass man nicht einfach
so gebrauchte Sachen tragen sollte.

English: Who knows what danger might lurk inside of it...
Chinese: 畢竟誰也不知道，究竟潛藏著多少“危險的東西”嘛～♪
Korean: 어떤 "위험한 것"이 감춰져 있을지 모르는거잖아♪
German: Wer weiß, was für Gefahren sich darin verbergen.

English:
What should I do about Kayaba? He's more or less
out of commission, but still...
Chinese:
…………茅場的事情，要怎麼處理？
暫且先牽制住他了。
Korean:
…………카야바 건은 어쩔 거냐?
일단 견제는 해 뒀지만
German:
Was soll ich wegen Kayaba unternehmen? Er ist mehr
oder weniger außer Gefecht, aber trotzdem ...

English:
You can leave him be. He's harmless as long as we
have his ledger.
Chinese:
不用管他也沒關係喔～
只要帳本還在我這，他就什麼都辦不到了～
Korean:
내버려둬도 상관없어~
장부가 이쪽에 있는 이상, 저런 녀석은 아무것도 할 수 없는걸~
German:
Du kannst ihn in Ruhe lassen. Solange wir sein
Hauptbuch haben, ist er harmlos.

English: Hee hee, what a moron!
Chinese: 嘻嘻，真是笨蛋呢～♪
Korean: 우후훗, 바보라니까~♪
German: Hihi, was für ein Idiot!

English:
Things turn out this way when the guy holding the
purse strings gets greedy and tries to raise
prices.
Chinese:
區區一個管錢的，卻貪心跑去玩炒作，
才會變成那種下場啦☆
Korean:
단순한 금고지기가 욕심을 부리며 가격을 올리려고 드니까
이런 꼴을 당하는거양♥
German:
So was passiert, wenn derjenige, der die Ausgaben
kontrolliert, gierig wird und versucht, die
Preise anzuheben.

English:
And he could've had such a tasty morsel to snack
on if he'd just done as he was told...
Chinese:
明明只要乖乖聽話做事，
就能嚐很多甜頭了～對吧♪
Korean:
시키는 일만 하고 있었으면
좋은 일이 생겼을 텐데…그치♪
German:
Und er hätte so ein leckeres Goodie haben können,
wenn er nur den Anweisungen gefolgt wäre ...

English: Ah, oh noooo! I, like, totally forgot to ask!
Chinese:
哎呀哎呀，不好了呢！
我忘記一件非常～重要的事了。
Korean:
어머어머, 안 되겠네~!
중~요한 것을 잊고있었어
German: Oh neeein! Das habe ich völlig vergessen!

English:
Please link this business data to these accounts
I got my hands on.
Chinese:
你拿過來的這些帳號……
請製造出他們跟這企業有牽扯的證據☆
Korean:
찾아준 계정 말인데……
이 기업의 데이터를 연결해줬으면 해♥
German:
Bitte stelle Verbindungen zwischen diesen
Geschäftsdaten und diesen Konten her.

English: With no traces of where they came from, of course.
Chinese: 當然，不可以留下痕跡喔♪
Korean: 물론 손댄 흔적은 남기지 않게, 말이지♪
German:
Ohne irgendwelche Spuren zu hinterlassen, woher
sie stammen, versteht sich.

English: This is...
Chinese: 這個是……
Korean: 이건……
German: Das ist ...

English: Hmm? Is there some sort of problem?
Chinese: 嗯～？　怎麼啦～？　有什麼問題嗎～？
Korean: 응응~? 왜에~? 뭐 질문이라도 있어~?
German: Hm? Gibt es ein Problem?

English: ...Oh, that reminds me.
Chinese: ……話說啊～
Korean: ……그러고보니이~
German: ... Ach, da fällt mir ein.

English:
I got a call from Central Hospital. Sounds like
the test results weren't all that good, huh?
Chinese:
“中央醫院”那裡有聯絡喔～？
“檢查結果”……好像不太好是不是？
Korean:
"센트럴 병원"에서 연락이 왔더라구~?
"검사 결과"…그다지 좋지 않았나봐?
German:
Ich habe einen Anruf vom Zentralkrankenhaus
erhalten. Klingt so, als ob die Testergebnisse
nicht besonders gut waren, was?

English: Urk...!
German: Argh ...!

English:
I guess there'll be a need for more treatment in
the future, yes?
Chinese: 以後還需要更多、更～多的“治療”對吧～？
Korean: 앞으로는 좀 더 좀~더 "치료"가 필요하게 되겠네~?
German:
Es werden wohl weitere Behandlungen notwendig
sein, was?

English:
Ah, well...what can you do? The kid needs it,
after all.
Chinese:
但是……這也無可奈何吧？
對“那孩子”來說治療不可或缺嘛。
Korean:
그치만……할 수 없잖아?
"그 아이"에게는 필요한 일인걸
German:
Nun ja ... Was soll man machen? Wenn sie es
nun mal braucht.

English: Heh heh heh... Now don't you worry!
Chinese: 嘻嘻……不要擔心嘛☆
Korean: 우후훗……걱정하지 말아♥
German: Hihihi ... Keine Sorge!

English: I'm doing everything in my power too, you know?
Chinese: 我呀，也是想盡力幫助她的喔？
Korean: 나도 할 수 있는 건 다 해주고 싶다고 생각한다구?
German: Ich tue doch alles, was in meiner Macht steht!

English:
Don't act so shocked! After all, you're working
yourself to the bone for Kamishiro...and by that,
I mean little ol' me!
Chinese:
不管怎麼說，龍司小親親為了神代
這～麼地拚命……
啊不對，是．為．了．“我”而工作的嘛☆
Korean:
누가 뭐래도 류지는 이~렇게 카미시로의……
으응, "나"를 위 해 서, 일해주고 있는걸♥
German:
Tu nicht so geschockt! Schließlich arbeitest du
dir die Finger wund für Kamishiro ... und damit
meine ich natürlich mich!

English:
You and me... We make beautiful music together,
don't you think?
Chinese: 我們……是很好的工作夥伴吧？
Korean: 우리들……훌륭한 비즈니스 파트너네?
German:
Du und ich ... Wir sind ein eingespieltes Team,
nicht wahr?

English:
Hee hee... Well then, I'll leave you to it,
my sweet little Ryuji.
Chinese:
呵呵……就這樣子囉。
工作就拜託你了，龍司小親親♪
Korean:
우후후……그러면
일에 대해선 잘 부탁해, 류지♪
German:
Hihi ... Na gut, dann lasse ich dich mal in Ruhe,
mein süßer kleiner Ryuji.
